citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are some good real-time voice translator apps you can use on phones: Top mobile apps Google Translate – free; has real-time speech translation and conversation mode in many languages. Google Translate
Microsoft Translator – supports live voice translation and conversation mode. Rick Steves Community

sources.title: iTranslate: The Leading Translation and Dictionary App
sources.snippet: iTranslate allows you to translate text, websites and start voice conversations. You can also lookup words, their meanings and conjugate verbs.Read more

citation_mappings.claim_text: iTranslate Voice / iTranslate – real-time speech translation with support for ~40+ languages. App Store+1
Instant Voice Translate – simple app focused on voice and text translation (70+ languages). Google Play
Naver Papago – conversation mode with voice for Asian and major languages. Wikipedia

sources.title: EzDubs: Best Phone Call Translator App for iOS and Android
sources.snippet: EzDubs offers real-time translation for phone calls, voice messages, text messages, and video messages. It also supports integration with video conferencing ...Read more

citation_mappings.claim_text: Specialized options EzDubs – real-time translation for phone calls and voice/video messages (iOS/Android). EzDubs

sources.title: Google Translate brings real-time speech translations to any headphones
sources.snippet:
Google Translate has introduced a major update allowing live speech translations on all headphones, not just Google's Pixel Buds. Available in beta starting today, the feature supports over 70 languages and requires only a compatible Android phone with the Translate app—unlike Apple’s version, which is limited to AirPods. This expansion marks a shift towards broader accessibility for real-time translation.

Additionally, Google Translate is improving text translations with the help of its Gemini AI, which enhances the accuracy of idioms and slang, offering more natural interpretations of phrases like “stealing my thunder.” The update also expands the Practice feature—similar to Duolingo—to 20 more countries and supports more languages. This interactive learning tool provides personalized sessions that adapt to users’ language levels.

The live translation update is rolling out on Android in the US, Mexico, and India, with an iOS version expected next year. Enhanced text translations are also now available on both Android and iOS, as well as the web. The Practice feature remains in beta and may be limited to some users.

citation_mappings.claim_text: If you want something that works hands-free with earbuds and live conversation built into audio gear, newer features in Google Translate can translate live speech to your headphones in real time (Android beta expanding globally). The Verge
